review_title: Big punch in a small package
one_reviews_text: I really liked the game for several reasons. It has a beginning, an end, interesting characters, great voice acting, nice music and interesting scenes.  The graphics are very simple, which makes the game run smooth.   The developer was right, it's nice that your opponents do wait a little to draw, but in doing so, you do appreciate the scenery more. one_reviews_text:
cute game for the price, some suggestions from a classical western duel lover:

the bandits were always the one who drew their gun first. part of the fun of the western duel is that tense concentration needed to draw second and still shoot first, since the person who draws first is gonna be the outlaw. so perhaps setting them to draw in a specific speed (ie: easier enemies should take up to a full second or two to draw their weapon and aim fully, and the boss should take much less time, scaled to focus on reaction time moreso than straight up quickness and accuracy. waiting for them to draw and if you draw first, you get a foul and must restart. 

i actually waited so long in the first duel because of expecting the first enemy to do this lol. in ng+ obviously they try are quicker to aim, but it's still not quite the same.

otherwise, fun cute game, nice cute twist, controls are fine and can't complain for the price. would be 5 stars and a great reaction time trainer if you made it more like a real (well: fantasy real) revolver duel system
review_feedback: Thanks for the great feedback. If you wait long enough they will draw on you (and when they do they're slower than if you draw first). In early versions of the game they would draw on you sooner than they do now, but some players complained they didn't have time to look around and admire the scenery before getting shot. Most enemies draw faster each time you complete a round in New Game+.
